pre-empt.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make what someone has planned to do or say unnecessary or ineffective by saying or doing something first
pre-empt.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The deal pre-empted a strike by rail workers.
pre-empt.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to replace a television show with a special programme or report
pre-empt.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Regular programming was preempted by a report on the war.
